locutie.beschrijving: Exegesis of Psalm 23 focusing on the political meaning of 'shepherd', the nature of sheep, and the metaphors of the traveler and the house of the Lord.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Provides historical-critical context (shepherd as king) and literary structure analysis.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily describing the world of the text and inviting the hearer to adopt a new perspective.
voorbeelden: The term shepherd is political in the Bible.
I invite you in this Lent to see differently.
Lent is a time to quit running.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Reflection, reorientation of desire, and a sense of calm trust.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The Spirit is not explicitly mentioned as the agent of change.

voorbeelden: The psalm begins, 'The LORD is my shepherd.'
The journey is one pervaded by threat and danger.
Notice that all the verbs of action are for the shepherd.
I invite you in this Lent to see differently.
The Twenty-third Psalm seems so sweet and so soft.
I suggest, is a Lenten project for all of us.
God’s friendliness and kindness will run after me.
He has sought out the best grazing ground.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Moderate. The promises are mostly described in the third person (about God) rather than delivered as direct address.

voorbeelden: I invite you in this Lent to see differently.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Low. The preacher acts as a teacher/inviter rather than a herald of a new reality.

indicatoren: Extensive explanation of what 'shepherd' meant in the ancient world.
Describing the behavior of sheep in the third person.
Analyzing the Pharisees' blindness as a literary theme.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a beautiful biblical world rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is left with an 'invitation' to change themselves rather than being changed by the Word.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Weak. They are framed as 'affirmations' or 'conclusions' of the poem rather than direct speech from God.
voorbeelden: God’s friendliness and kindness will run after me and chase me down.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address used mostly for moral invitation at the end.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Low. Used for 'You should see' rather than 'God gives to you'.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant. Talking about 'the psalmist', 'the sheep', 'the traveler', 'the Pharisees'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: High. It treats the text as an object to be studied.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about God and society.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Explanation of Psalm) -> Directive (Invitation to see differently).
voorbeelden: The poem invites us to two images... I invite you to see differently.
foutief_patroon.probleem: It bypasses the Declarative/Commissive. It moves from information to moral/spiritual demand without the intervening act of God's promise.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Missing the 'Toezegging' (Promise) as the engine of the sermon.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: Faith in this God requires a refocus... (Imperative without the power of the promise).

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a high-level lecture on the theology of Psalm 23. It explains the text brilliantly but fails to 'do' the text to the hearer.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The term shepherd is political in the Bible. It means king...
sterke_punten.effect: Deepens intellectual understanding of the text.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Lent is about noticing our blindness...
zwakke_punten.probleem: It turns the Gospel into a task for the hearer (noticing) rather than an act of God (healing).

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is a talk *about* an event (the Psalm) rather than being an event itself.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Lacks the 'verbum visibile' quality; the word does not 'happen' to the listener.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: No. God is the object of the preacher's description.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Weak. Preacher acts as an 'inviter' rather than an ambassador.
tekstueel_bewijs: I suggest, is a Lenten project...

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly assumes the hearer can 'decide' to see differently through their own effort.
tekstueel_bewijs: I invite you... to see past your anxiety.
The poem concludes, as you know, with two affirmations.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 3rd person 'is' and 'means' verbs. Needs 2nd person 'gives', 'promises', 'forgives'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: God’s friendliness and kindness will run after me.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Right now, God's mercy is chasing you down; He holds you fast.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a future/general truth to a present/personal reality.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is buried in the analysis of the poem.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Interrupt the exegesis to speak the promise directly to the congregation.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because Yahweh is your shepherd, you lack nothing today.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'You' to bridge the gap between the text and the hearer.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the sheep He is leading.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The 'invitation' feels like a new law.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Base the invitation to 'see' on the fact that Christ has already opened their eyes.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is intellectually stimulating but homiletically static. To move from 'talking about' to 'event', the preacher must dare to speak for God, not just about Him.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' or 'appeal'. SAT reveals that the sermon fails because it lacks the 'Declarative' force required for a sacramental act.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, this is excellent (metaphor, structure). SAT shows that even good rhetoric can be 'constatively stuck'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the 'Lenten invitation' is a Directive that lacks a Commissive foundation, making it moralistic rather than sacramental.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The term shepherd is political in the Bible.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Good for teaching, neutral for preaching.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: I invite you in this Lent to see differently.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Weak without a prior declaration of grace.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Constative Surplus'. It provides a brilliant map of the territory (Psalm 23) but never actually takes the hearer on the journey.
